title: Boundary-Crossing Project-Based Learning for Interdisciplinary Language Understanding

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Analysis Skills and Foundational Knowledge in Other Academic Disciplines
context.additional_context: Work-integrated interdisciplinary problem-solving leveraging professional experience

learning_goals: Learners can analyze linguistic phenomena by integrating concepts from three or more academic disciplines (linguistics, sociology, and digital humanities).
Learners can derive interdisciplinary solutions through meaningful dialogue with peers/experts using collaborative tools.
Learners can complete interdisciplinary projects in a BYOD environment by utilizing free/low-cost technological tools (cloud collaboration platforms, data visualization tools).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
